channel.title: Stackable items
channel.description: How do I make an item stackable in delta?

Okay, if that doesn’t work then you will need to Hex edit it.

.DAT files save in binary, so it could be a little difficult for him if he doesn’t know how to edit binary.

item.title: Stackable items
item.dc:creator: @Saphire1 Saphire`
item.description:
@Saphire1 wrote:

Hey, I’m not sure about Delta although this should work out a bit for you.

I assume you have Item.java correct? If so then add this code in and tell me what the outcome is.

public static boolean[] itemStackable = new boolean[7000]; public static boolean[] itemIsNote = new boolean[7000];

[code] static {
int counter = 0;
int c;

    try {
        FileInputStream dataIn = new FileInputStream(new File("data/stackable.dat"));
        while ((c = dataIn.read()) != -1) {
            if (c == 0)
                itemStackable[counter] = false;
            else
                itemStackable[counter] = true;
            counter++;
        }
        dataIn.close();
    } catch (IOException e) {
        System.out.println("Critical error while loading stackabledata! Trace:");
        e.printStackTrace();
    }

    counter = 0;

    try {
        FileInputStream dataIn = new FileInputStream(new File("data/notes.dat"));
        while ((c = dataIn.read()) != -1) {
            if (c == 0)
                itemIsNote[counter] = true;
            else
                itemIsNote[counter] = false;
            counter++;
        }
        dataIn.close();
    } catch (IOException e) {
        System.out.println("Critical error while loading notedata! Trace:");
        e.printStackTrace();
    }

}[/code]

This should work, although I’m not sure about the methods you use so things may need to be changed.

Read full topic
